ianmcook commented on pull request #10373:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10373#issuecomment-849631610


   Thanks @thisisnic, this looks good to me!
   
   There was some discussion about whether we should include this in `DESCRIPTION`:
   
   ```
   Suggests: 
       roxygen2
   Remotes:  
       r-lib/roxygen2
   ```
   Were we to do that, the existing instruction to run `remotes::install_deps(dependencies = TRUE)` (in `developing.Rmd`) would install `roxygen2` from GitHub. 
   
   Any opinions on the pros and cons of doing that vs. simply keeping the instruction to run `remotes::install_github("r-lib/roxygen2")` that is added to `developing.Rmd` in this PR?
   
   cc @jonkeane 
   
   


--

jonkeane commented on pull request #10373:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10373#issuecomment-849659359


   Yeah, I think this is fine to merge. One thing to note, that version number requirement might be satisfied but with a dev version that doesn't include the feature we're using (I haven't checked the git history, but I imagine there are commits after the last release, but before they added `examplesif`). Which would be annoying to diagnose, but with our comment about needing an up-to-date roxygen2, that should hopefully be enough.  I'll comment on the jira with thoughts about `DESCRIPTION` itself.
   
   Do we already have or do we need/want a CI job that checks if the docs can be built when these features aren't around — I assume that `examplesif` works just fine, but it would be good for us to check that we've not accidentally forgotten it / used the wrong test / etc. (this can of course also be a follow on)


-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

ianmcook commented on pull request #10373:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10373#issuecomment-849668720


   > Do we already have or do we need/want a CI job that checks if the docs can be built when these features aren't around — I assume that `examplesif` works just fine, but it would be good for us to check that we've not accidentally forgotten it / used the wrong test / etc. (this can of course also be a follow on)
   
   Perhaps this could be incorporated into a CI task that also checks that the `Rd` files have been built. I believe we don't currently have that, and several times recently PRs have been merged without the docs being built. Maybe we could achieve this by adding to an existing CI task instead of adding a new one.


--

jonkeane commented on pull request #10373:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10373#issuecomment-849680842


   Yes, adding to an existing CI job would be great. Though the thing I was wondering about testing is running examples with a minimal build to make sure they skip appropriately. I think we could add that on to the minimal build CI job (and then maybe also add on a run-the-examples step to one of the more maximal builds to make sure they run when things *are* available?). Checking for missing Rds would be great (and maybe could be part of the script that checks for missing topics from [ARROW-12236](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions/runs/879127390)?)


--

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: [R] Use roxygen @examplesIf tag in R docs

comments.body:
Update based on continued work in ARROW-11735:
The {{arrow_with_dataset()}} and {{arrow_with_parquet()}} conditionals have been removed from all the examples, and examples that contained them have been wrapped in {{\dontrun}} instead of {{\donttest}} which gives us a stronger guarantee that these examples will not cause check failures. After using {{@examplesIf}}, switch these examples back to using {{\donttest}}, or use neither if that works.
